title: Port generate-html.ps1 to Python
description: Create scripts/generate_html.py as a direct port of generate-html.ps1. ~180 lines. argparse for --data-file and --output-file. pathlib for template path. json.loads/re.sub for data+template. Same positioning math, color maps, HTML fragment builders. chmod +x with #!/usr/bin/env python3 shebang.
close_reason: Created scripts/generate_html.py — direct Python port of generate-html.ps1. Tested with sample data, output verified correct.

title: Fix browser history timezone: use local time instead of UTC
description: browser_history.py uses UTC for day boundaries (line 69) but the user's 'day' is in local time. For UTC+1 users, this means visits from midnight-1am local are attributed to the wrong day. Should use local timezone for day start/end boundaries.

title: Add example data JSON file for testing HTML generator
description: The examples/ directory only has screenshot.png. Add a sample data JSON file matching the schema in generate_html.py so users can test the HTML generator independently without needing CASS.
close_reason: Not needed — generate_html.py is only called by the skill workflow, users would never manually invoke it

title: Clean up temp files after day-summary run
description: Each run leaves 8+ files on ~/Desktop/ (extract txts, stats JSON, browser history text, browser_history_tmp.db). Only the final HTML is the desired output. Add cleanup of intermediate files. The browser DB copy is also a privacy concern.

title: Delete PowerShell scripts
description: Remove scripts/gather-stats.ps1 and scripts/generate-html.ps1. Python works on all platforms and CASS already requires Python. No reason to maintain two implementations.

title: Translate German comments to English in browser_history.py
description: browser_history.py has German docstrings and comments while the rest of the codebase is English. Translate all German text to English for consistency.

title: Update README.md for cross-platform support
description: Platform: macOS, Linux, Windows. Prerequisites: replace PowerShell with Python 3. Install: add ln -s alongside New-Item Junction. File structure: update script filenames from .ps1 to .py. Update How it works section.

title: Add requirements.txt (stdlib-only note)
description: No dependency manifest exists. All scripts use only stdlib, but users have no way to know without reading every import. Add a requirements.txt with a comment noting stdlib-only, or a minimal pyproject.toml.

title: Fix YYYY-MM-DD+1 pseudo-placeholder in SKILL.md evening block
description: SKILL.md line 54-55 uses YYYY-MM-DD+1 as a placeholder for the next day's date in the evening time block. This isn't a valid date expression and could confuse both users and the AI agent executing the skill. Replace with explicit instructions or compute it.

title: Add macOS and Linux browser history paths
description: browser_history.py only has Windows paths (AppData/Local/...). macOS (~/Library/Application Support/Google/Chrome/Default/History) and Linux (~/.config/google-chrome/Default/History) are missing. Script silently returns empty results on non-Windows.

title: Update SKILL.md for cross-platform support
description: Remove all powershell references. Phase 1: promote cass commands as primary workflow, remove gather-stats.ps1 dependency. Phase 3: replace powershell invocation with python3 generate_html.py. Day-of-week: python3 one-liner. Browser open: platform-agnostic instruction. Remove 'if script fails' framing.
close_reason: Removed all powershell references from SKILL.md. Day-of-week uses python3. Stats gathering uses cass commands directly. HTML generation uses python3 generate_html.py. Browser open is platform-agnostic.

title: Remove unused re import in generate_html.py
description: Line 41 of generate_html.py imports re but it's never used. Dead code from the PowerShell port.

title: Update README: stale docs, missing install guidance, wrong file structure
description:
README has multiple stale/incorrect sections that need updating:
- CASS prerequisite has no installation guidance (blocker for new users)
- setup_agent.py is listed but was deleted
- File structure section is stale: missing pre_extract.py and browser_history.py
- haiku-reader agent is described as auto-created but the mechanism no longer exists
- Repo name (Coding-Day-Recap) vs skill dir (day-summary) mismatch not explained
- Missing mkdir -p ~/.claude/skills step before symlink command

title: Explain Claude Code skill system in README
description: README assumes the user knows how Claude Code skills work (~/.claude/skills/, SKILL.md frontmatter, /skillname invocation). Add a brief explanation or link to docs for users who haven't set up custom skills before.
